title: Escalope de Dinde Panée aux Cacahuètes MADIVIAL (Peanut-Crusted Turkey Escalope)

instructions.instruction_text: Marinate the turkey fillets in lime juice with crushed garlic. Add 1g salt and pepper to taste. Let rest for at least 20 minutes.
Prepare the herb sauce: finely chop the parsley and local onion. Strip the thyme leaves from the branch. Crush the dried green pepper.
Mix the white cheese with the chopped herbs, crushed green pepper, olive oil, and salt. Refrigerate the sauce until serving.
Pulse the roasted peanuts in a food processor to create coarse crumbs (not too fine, leave some texture).
Set up three breading stations: one bowl with flour, one with beaten eggs, and one with crushed peanuts.
Remove the turkey fillets from the marinade and pat dry. Coat each fillet first in flour, shaking off excess.
Dip the floured fillets in the beaten eggs, ensuring complete coverage.
Press the egg-coated fillets firmly into the crushed peanuts, coating all sides thoroughly.
Heat 3-4 cm of oil in a deep pan. Test the temperature by dropping in a small piece of onion skin - it should sizzle immediately.
Carefully place the breaded fillets in the hot oil. Fry until golden brown on both sides and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Remove the escalopes from the oil and drain on paper towels. Cover loosely with foil to keep warm until serving.
Serve the peanut-crusted turkey escalopes hot with the chilled herb sauce on the side.
